alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 7:06PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Calhoun and Cleburne. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 706 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anniston, Jacksonville, Piedmont, Heflin, Saks, Glencoe, Weaver, Ohatchee, Fruithurst, Edwardsville, Jacksonville State University, Alexandria, Mars Hills, Muscadine, Neely Henry Lake, Southside, Liberty Hill, Coleman Lake And Campground, Sweetwater Lake and Knightens Crossroads.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
